incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We're still actively monitoring the region stability to ensure the service remains fully available until we finish fully addressing the issue. All service are fully working as expected right now.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

We have detected an issue affecting service on the EU-4 region. Our Operations team has been notified and is currently working to restore service. We will update you as soon as we have further information.

An unknown issue occurred with the host agent on one of the hosts in the region, leading to processes being stuck which in turn lead to sites on the affected host being unavailable.

To remediate the situation, our Operations Team evacuated all projects from the host to other hosts in the region and terminated the affected host in order to free the stuck processes.

Most affected sites were recovered in less than 25 minutes.

Unfortunately, in terminating the affected host, any logs on the host were lost. This is because the normal termination signal was not responsive, and our Operations Team had to manually terminate the host.

This was an abnormal situation and we took this action to try get the sites back up as quickly as possible.

To prevent such situations in the future we're implementing guidelines to ensure we retain logs when we manually terminate hosts for incidents such as this.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

**Overview**

On March 2nd, at 20:23 UTC an incident was declared for the us-2 region. On-call engineers began receiving alerts for multiple sites down and immediately began an investigation.

**What Happened**

A maintenance operation applied to the storage layer unintentionally resulted in degraded performance for most of the grid hosts in the region. The purpose of the maintenance was to improve the storage layer by switching to an upgraded back end but the migration to this new system resulted in elevated CPU resource consumption leading to a major performance impact on any environment running on one of these affected hosts.

**Resolution**

In order to mitigate the impact of the incident, additional storage layer resources were provisioned and deployed to the region. The migration was able to continue as planned and grid hosts began to recover as expected.

**Impact**

We have paused this same maintenance across all regions to assess how to safely move forward.

This incident has been resolved.

We have released a fix for the storage backend and now region US-2 should function as expected.
Please create support ticket for further assistance if needed.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We have identified the cause as related to our storage backend. We are issuing a fix now and will provide updates soon.
We are aware of some projects within the US-2 region that are experiencing a variety of issues. We are currently investigating and will provide updates when we have more information.

Currently the AWS region us-east-2  is having an incident. https://health.aws.amazon.com/health/status

We are actively working to determine what we can do to mitigate this issue on our side. We will update as once we have more information.

**Overview**

On July 21st, at 03:11 UTC, our On-call engineers began receiving alerts for multiple sites down on the AU and CA-1 and immediately began an investigation. They verified that environments and console requests were timing out.

**What Happened**

A sudden influx of traffic was identified from several malicious sources. This caused the edge services in the AU and CA-1 regions to experience extremely high load which resulted in connectivity issues with customer environments and consoles.Our engineers confirmed the origin of the attack and took action to mitigate the malicious traffic. Once mitigations were completed, site monitoring reported that the sites were accessible again.

**Resolution**

We are implementing additional methods to minimise the impacts of this type of attack.

**Impact**

The incident prevented access to all projects in the AU and CA-1 regions. Once mitigations were in place, sites immediately became accessible again and service was restored to normal. Individual projects experienced unavailability of up to one hour at most. The total length of the incident, including the monitoring period, lasted for 90 minutes.
This incident has been resolved.
All alerts are now showing as resolved. We are continuing to monitor these regions.
Sites are recovering. We are continuing to work on resolving this outage.
We are actively working to resolve this issue.

We have detected an issue affecting service on the au.platform.sh and ca-1.platform.sh regions. We are currently working to restore service.

This issue affects multiple production sites as well as development environments. Access to your site, project UI as well as Git and SSH access may be affected.

This outage does not affect Dedicated Enterprise Clusters.

We will update you as soon as we have further information.

incidents.name: Console and CLI Outage Across all Regions

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
We are currently investigating an outage impacting the Console and CLI across all regions. Production sites are still serving requests, but Console and CLI access is currently degraded.

**Overview**

New Blackfire APM data was unavailable for up to 15 hours.

**What Happened**

Due to a code change made in early July to the APM consumer service, the disk space on the underlying infrastructure exceeded its estimated requirement resulting in a disk full event. This resulted in an inability to process data in a reasonable time in addition to some loss of monitoring data between 16 July 0540 UTC and 16 July 0940 UTC.

**Resolution**

* Additional disk storage was added to the volume.
* Additional disk monitoring and alerts have been added.
* A review of the recent code changes is underway to reduce the impact on disk storage.

**Impact**

During this incident customers dashboards did not display new data. Once the consumer was recovered, live data was ingested in realtime in parallel with the backlog and all available data was up-to-date after approximately 15 hours.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results. The backlog of messages are currently being processed.

We have detected an issue affecting Blackfire service. Our Operations team has been notified and is currently working to restore service. 

We will update you as soon as we have further information.

We are having some issues with our data pipeline. We are still receiving data from agents, but they are not processed anymore. Your APM dashboards have not been updated since July 15th 10PM UTC. We are working on resuming the processing. No data has been lost. Performance of applications running Blackfire agent is not affected

**Overview**

On July 11th, at 06:45 UTC, an incident was declared for the \(de-2\) region. Platform.sh monitoring detected a number of sites down alerts during the scheduled maintenance, https://status.platform.sh/incidents/vt4zmxmjqdlk - upon further investigation we determined the issue was due to multiple overloaded hosts. We provisioned additional hosts to alleviate the load and rebalanced the environments across these new hosts.

What Happened

The maintenance was performed on the orchestration layer, which included an update to our backup process. 

After the maintenance, we saw that this updated backup process caused a higher than expected load on an agent running on the hosts there by slowing down the recovery of sites. Plaform.sh technical teams have determined the root cause of high load on the agent, and a fix is being planned for roll-out in the near future.

**Impact**

The incident impacted both production and development environments. Most projects were recovered by 08:09 UTC, with a small portion of projects needing manual recovery by Platform.sh engineers. Observed downtime ranged from 30 minutes to 2 hours.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

We have detected an issue affecting service on the DE2 region. This is related to the scheduled maintenance, https://status.platform.sh/incidents/vt4zmxmjqdlk and is causing longer outages than expected.

Our Operations team has been notified and is currently working to restore service. 

We will update you as soon as we have further information.
